name: climatically
content:

in a way that relates to the climate (= general or long-term weather conditions) : Things are climatically very different on the two sides of the mountains. Cheap flights are not climatically or economically sustainable. At 1.5 degrees Celsius of global warming, 6% of insects, 8% of plants, and 4% of vertebrates will see their climatically determined geographic range reduced by more than half.
More examplesFewer examplesClimatically, the desert is a violent place.With coastlines on three oceans, a large upland interior, and a northern boundary inside the Tropics, South Africa is a climatically diverse country.The researchers wrote that the increasingly intense storms over the Pacific in winter are climatically significant.
